page.title: 19HEALTH IN THIS AREA(CONT)
page.content: burning. This still sometimes causes smog, a mixture of smoke and fog which has been stopped in most other places by the clean air act. Though there is little coal mining now, many older men worked underground in the pits for many years and have lung disease (pneumoconiosis) as a result. Some diseases are connected with agriculture, such as farmer's lung caused by mouldy hay. Most of the people were born locally, and there are very few immigrants or travellers with unusual diseases. Most medical emergency admissions to hospital are caused by strokes, heart attacks, chest infections and asthma, and overdoses of tablets and alcohol. The average age of these patients is over 65 years, and the average stay in hospital is just over a week. Almost all the treatment
